Description: Body sherd of large East Greek (North Ionian) Wild Goat Style pottery bowl; dirty white slip; interior glazed streaky black; concentric bands in added white and added red; exterior: painted decoration consisting of possibly a goat (one foreleg and very low underbelly remaining) to right; below, narrow and wide brown bands; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The number 115 is written in pencil on the sherd's exterior surface. The sherd joins sherd 1888,0601.183. Probably sherd 1965,0930.211 belongs to the same vessel.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.091)
